Posts.Content: rocksteady14 wrote: Hi, all; I've referenced this site throughout the last year or so, but this is my first post.  Summer '10 I found a lump in my left breast, but as I was beginning my Masters Degree, I put off getting it checked until November 2010.  Doctor ordered an ultrasound, and a core needle biopsy was performed.  The lump was diagnosed as a fibroadenoma.  My doctor instructed me to have a mammogram performed in June 2011 as a check-up, but imaging dept said that was incorrect and performed another ultrasound (although Dr. ordered mammo).  The fibroadenoma did not bother me much, just the occassional ache and it never acted up during my menstrual cycle, but last night the pain was excruciating.  I was going to sleep, and as I turned onto my stomach, my left breast felt like something was tearing inside, and the pain was centered around the lump.  I had to take 400mg of Ibuprofen to get comfortable enough to sleep, but today it is throbbing, and I cannot tell if the shape of my breast is different or if I'm over-reacting.  I called the gynecologist and I'm going in tomorrow for a check-up.   Have any of you experienced similar pain with a fibroadenoma?  For reference, I'm 23.  Thanks in advance, and I'm grateful to have found this community! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Fibroadenoma is larger, painful rocksteady14 Sommer43
